sentences: Alan Reid (born 2 May 1950, Glasgow, Scotland) is a Scottish folk multi-instrumentalist and songwriter.

Alan Reid (born 2 May 1950, Glasgow, Scotland) is a Scottish folk multi-instrumentalist and songwriter. He was a founding member of Battlefield Band, which combined traditional Celtic melodies and new material.
Alan Reid joined Battlefield Band in 1969, at a time when they were evolving into a folk group.
In 1997, while remaining a member of Battlefield Band, Reid released his first solo album, The Sunlit Eye, on Temple Records.
Reid also formed a duo with singer/guitarist Rob van Sante and released a CD in 2002 entitled Under The Blue which featured more new songs.
In 2009, he was nominated at the Scots Traditional Awards in the Composer of the Year category.
=== 2010–present: Battlefield Band departure and duo with van Sante ===
He left the band at the end of 2010 to concentrate on his musical duo with Rob van Sante who had also been Battlefield Band's sound engineer for a number of years.
In 2011, Reid released Recollection, a compilation album of the finest songs he wrote during his forty years with Battlefield Band.
Tuomas Holopainen – Music Inspired by the Life and Times of Scrooge (2014)
